page.title: 16SOUTH SHIELDS RIVER PILOTS
page.content: The South Shields Pilots' Lookout Post overlooks the Harbour of the River Tyne. A 24 hour watch is kept by the pilots waiting to guide ships up the river. Passenger ships from Scandinavia, merchant ships from around the world and naval vessels, all need the services of the pilots. Today's pilots are greatly helped by modern technology both in their work and in their safety. The pilots have coats which can be inflated to make life-jackets should they fall overboard. A torch is built into the coat,and would be triggered off by salt in the water so that the pilot can be seen at night. The Tyne Pilots have always manned the lifeboat when ships have run ashore. They have saved thousands of lives.
